intro: Pentanisia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pentanisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
